unit.utterance: tutir Lanangmaté.
unit.utterance_translation: (This is) a story of Lanangmate.

unit.utterance: Lanangmaté ta pina mo bu.
unit.utterance_translation: Lanangmate made a trap.

unit.utterance: bu ta kènang bau simir ndalam brang.
unit.utterance_translation: The trap was (normally) intended for getting eels in the river.

unit.utterance: tapi Lanangmaté ta, lin kè tau lin.
unit.utterance_translation: But Lanangmate was different from other people.

unit.utterance: nya pasang bu pang tenga rau.
unit.utterance_translation: He put a trap in the middle of the field.

unit.utterance: setela petang nè, sióp laló gita kodong ta, bu ta é.
unit.utterance_translation: After the night, in the morning, (he) went and saw the trap.

unit.utterance: bang bu ta nan lempó ling mentrènè.
unit.utterance_translation: Unexpectedly, termites filled the trap.

unit.utterance: karing mentrènè ta, ètè ling nya.
unit.utterance_translation: So he took the termites.

unit.utterance: sengisi mo ling ta lakó buka è.
unit.utterance_translation: He put (them) into the trap.

unit.utterance: karing bawa bagai pengganti anong, bab rusak kodong ling nya.
unit.utterance_translation: So (he) brought it as a compensation, because it broke the trap.

unit.utterance: ganti ling nya kè anong kè ntrene ta bage imbalan.
unit.utterance_translation: He replaced (it) with the termite as compensation.

unit.utterance: bawa mo ntrene ta na, dapat sópó tokal nè tau jempang ayam.
unit.utterance_translation: (He) brought the termite. He arrived a place where people kept fowls.

unit.utterance: sengaró mo grènè ta, yaolo pang anong jempang ayam ta.
unit.utterance_translation: He left the termite and put it a place keeping fowls.

unit.utterance: bilin mo ling nya, <ngu> remalik-remalik nè.
unit.utterance_translation: He left them. (When) he returned,

unit.utterance: mengrene ta nè bóé mo kakan ling ayam, nuntut nya.
unit.utterance_translation: The termite was gone eaten by the chickens. He asked for compensation.

unit.utterance: lamin ta luk mentrènè ku bóé ba ayam ta mo ku=ètè mo nya.
unit.utterance_translation: "If the termite was gone in this way, I will take the fowls."

unit.utterance: ètè mo ayam ta, dadi nya belangan mo nya ana.
unit.utterance_translation: He took the fowl, and he walked to over there.

unit.utterance: mara ling dunung entek muru nè.
unit.utterance_translation: Like an old sayings, (he) went up a hill.

unit.utterance: dapat sópó dèsa dapat ntau nuja ta nè.
unit.utterance_translation: (He) arrived a village, (he) arrived a (place where) people were pounding.

unit.utterance: karing ayam ta nè sangaró mo pang’ pang tau nuja ta.
unit.utterance_translation: Then (he) left the fowl to a place where people were pounding.

unit.utterance: mè mè ka luk, dènèng tau nuja ta teri.
unit.utterance_translation: In some ways (lit. which was a way?), the stick of the people pounding fell.

unit.utterance: dapat mo anong ayam ta.
unit.utterance_translation: (The stick) hit the fowl.

unit.utterance: mate ayam.
unit.utterance_translation: The fowl died.

unit.utterance: karena maté ayam, nya nuntut.
unit.utterance_translation: Because the fowl died, he asked for compensation.

unit.utterance: ba ganti kè dènènta mo ling, ling nya nè.
unit.utterance_translation: Then he exchanged the fowl for the stick.

unit.utterance: dan nan mo balandan mo kebali na, belangan belangan belangan belangan.
unit.utterance_translation: Then (he) walked again, (he) walked walked walked and walked.

unit.utterance: kira nya ompa mo belangan nè, berenang.
unit.utterance_translation: He thought he was tired from walking. (He) stopped.

unit.utterance: senyélé mo anong na, óló mo dèta dènèng ta è pang bara kebo.
unit.utterance_translation: He left the stick (lit. what's it called), (he) put that, the stick in the buffalo shed.

unit.utterance: bilén mo nya ana.
unit.utterance_translation: He left for overthere.

unit.utterance: remalik remalik nè gita dènèng ta nè,
unit.utterance_translation: (When) he returned and saw the stick,

unit.utterance: kamo bela, rempang ling kebo.
unit.utterance_translation: (it) was broken by being trodden on by the buffalo.

unit.utterance: dan nya nan tuntut. lako baèng kebo ta è.
unit.utterance_translation: Then he asked for compensation to the owner of the buffalo.

unit.utterance: 'karna kebo=ta ka=sebela dènèng ku, ma kebo ta ku dènan', 'ya', bèang kebo ta bèang.
unit.utterance_translation: "My stick was broken, then I want to take (lit. lead) the buffalo." "All right." "The owner gave (the buffalo to him)."

unit.utterance: nya dènan kebo ta ana.
unit.utterance_translation: He led the buffalo to over there.

unit.utterance: kira ompa belangan ba dapat sópó katokal nè
unit.utterance_translation: He thought he was tired from walking and arrived at one place.

unit.utterance: sat mo kebo ta pang bawa nangka
unit.utterance_translation: (He) tied the buffalo to the bottom of a jackfruit (tree).

unit.utterance: nangka ta peno bua
unit.utterance_translation: The jackfruit (tree) had a lot of fruits.

unit.utterance: ada dè masak-masak mbao nè
unit.utterance_translation: Ripe ones were on the tree.

unit.utterance: sebilin kebo ta balé nya nè <nan> pang nangka.
unit.utterance_translation: He left the buffalo again under the jackfruit tree.
unit.add_comments: An element should have been 'ling nya' in this position, but it isn't.

unit.utterance: beru remalik mo na laló gita kebo ta è pato-pato mo remalik
unit.utterance_translation: When he returned, (he) went and saw the buffalo. Unexpectedly, (when he) returned,

unit.utterance: mbang kebo ta kamo maté
unit.utterance_translation: unexpectedly, the buffalo was dead.

unit.utterance: ka=dapat ka=teri anong, ka=teri nangka masak nè dè nangka nè, maté kebo.
unit.utterance_translation: (It was) hit by a fallen something. A riped jackfruit fell, and the buffalo died.

unit.utterance: nan si luk nya bali na, nuntut
unit.utterance_translation: He did it again. (lit. That was again his way.) (He) asked for compensation.

unit.utterance: ba nan luk nè ba nangka ta mo bawa
unit.utterance_translation: Then that was the way, (he) took (lit. brought) the jackfruits.

unit.utterance: pongo nangka ta.
unit.utterance_translation: He bore the jackfruits on his shoulder.

unit.utterance: dalam palangan tama mo sópó dèsa.
unit.utterance_translation: In the journey, he went into a village.

unit.utterance: pongo nangka ta.
unit.utterance_translation: He was bearing jackfruits on his shoulder.

unit.utterance: kebetulan babas balé tau tau pitu
unit.utterance_translation: He happened to pass by a house of seven girls.

unit.utterance: nangka nan óló pang bao pantar
unit.utterance_translation: (He) put the jackfruits onto the bench.

unit.utterance: bilin nangka ta.
unit.utterance_translation: (He) left the jackfruits.

unit.utterance: bilin ling nya nan nangka ta
unit.utterance_translation: He left the jackfruits.

unit.utterance: lampa ka=bilin nè ba remalik molé na
unit.utterance_translation: Unexpectedly, having left (jackfruits), (when) he got back,

unit.utterance: pato-pato nangka ta nè ka mo kakan dara pitu ta
unit.utterance_translation: Unexpectedly, the seven girls had eaten the jackfruits.

unit.utterance: bóé kakan
unit.utterance_translation: (The jackfruit) had gone eaten (by them).

unit.utterance: 'wa', nuntut nya, 'nènè sama kakan nangka ta,
unit.utterance_translation: "Wa." He asked for compensation, "You all ate the jackfruits,

unit.utterance: ba tó nènè, nènè harus ku=ètè.
unit.utterance_translation: then now, you, I have to take you."

unit.utterance: dadi nan rua anong nè
unit.utterance_translation: Then that was the situation.

unit.utterance: ampa nurit dadara pitu ta
unit.utterance_translation: Unexpectedly, the seven girls follwed.

unit.utterance: sepitu nè, ètè ling nya, kuasai ling nya.
unit.utterance_translation: He took all the seven girls. He conquered (them).

unit.utterance: lampa nan nè nurit na bawa dadara pitu ta è
unit.utterance_translation: Unexpectedly (they) followed. (He) brought the seven girls.

unit.utterance: dapat endèng brang nè
unit.utterance_translation: (They) arrived at the riverside.

unit.utterance: dapat nè mbrang nè, dadara pitu ta tokal pang bao batu
unit.utterance_translation: (They) arrived at a river. The seven girls were sitting on a stone.

unit.utterance: mbao batu, sepitu dèan
unit.utterance_translation: on the stone, they are all the seven.

unit.utterance: nya nan laló selagawè dalam brang
unit.utterance_translation: He went to the river for ease nature.

unit.utterance: mbang mole-mole nè
unit.utterance_translation: Unexpectedly, (when) he returned,

unit.utterance: dadara pitu ta nomonda, barari.
unit.utterance_translation: the seven girls were not there. They had run away.

unit.utterance: terpaksa batu ta nè ètè ling nya angkit
unit.utterance_translation: He was forced to take the stone. (He) lifted (it).

unit.utterance: bawa po dèta
unit.utterance_translation: (He) brought it.

unit.utterance: jadi nan si bóé nè mudi mo, ka bóé mo
unit.utterance_translation: Then that is the end. (It is) at the end.

unit.utterance: nongka makè dèta ta batu ta nè
unit.utterance_translation: There was no use for the stone.

unit.utterance: dadi tutir ta nè bóé ba tumpu.
unit.utterance_translation: Then this story is at an end, then finished.
